title: Latest buzz from NFL training camp: What we heard at 16 teams' practices, plus fantasy intel
content: Our national reporters visited 16 NFL teams since training camps began, talking to players and coaches about what to expect this season.

title: ESPN acquiring NFL Network, RedZone from NFL
content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: Sex toy tossed on Sparks' court; 3rd time in week
content: Another sex toy was thrown onto the court during Tuesday's WNBA game between the Fever and Sparks, the third such incident in the past seven days.

title: Jerry confident Parsons available for opener? 'No'
content: Cowboys owner and GM Jerry Jones is not confident Pro Bowl edge rusher Micah Parsons will be available for the Sept. 4 season opener against the Eagles. "No, absolutely not," Jones said Tuesday. "A big part of that is his decision. How would I know that?"

title: 49ers TE Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban
content: The NFL is banning the use of smelling salts and ammonia packets before and during all games, a ruling that has upset 49ers TE George Kittle.

title: Sasaki taking next step in rehab: No shoulder pain
content: Roki Sasaki says he has "no pain" in his right shoulder and is scheduled to pitch three simulated innings at Dodger Stadium over the weekend.

title: Shedeur will start preseason opener, sources say
content: The Browns are expected to start rookie Shedeur Sanders at quarterback for the team's preseason opener against the Panthers on Friday, sources told ESPN.

title: Former Heat security guard charged in $2M heist
content: A former Miami Heat security officer accused of selling stolen jerseys and other memorabilia worth millions of dollars made his initial appearance in federal court Tuesday.

title: 📸 Bulls bring back MJ-era pinstripe unis
content: Jordan and the Bulls first wore the threads during the 1995-96 campaign when the team went 72-10 and won a championship.

title: Bo Nix keeps passing every test
content: How did Broncos coach Sean Payton know Nix was the real deal? A finely tuned QB evaluation process told him, as detailed in the book "American Kings: A Biography of the Quarterback."

title: Team that cooked, most frustrated fan bases and more: Passan's trade deadline awards
content: What we learned from the deals -- and titles for the teams with the most interesting elements of trade season.

title: 'He never wanted to leave': How Damian Lillard's return to Portland began 18 months ago
content: After two seasons in Milwaukee, Damian Lillard returns to Portland with a torn Achilles and confidence in his future.

title: Power Rankings: Dream climb while Lynx, Liberty contend with star injuries
content: Atlanta rides a three-game winning streak up the board while Minnesota and New York navigate without their stars.

title: WNBA trade grades: Report cards for every major deal
content: Adding Brittney Sykes gives Seattle the WNBA's most versatile perimeter trio ahead of the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: The 40 most important players in college football this season
content: From QBs on surefire CFP contenders to potential stars looking to break through, these players will shape the 2025 season.

title: Confidence, conditioning and catches: What we've learned about Travis Hunter so far
content: The Jaguars' dual receiver and cornerback has had an eventful two weeks in his first NFL training camp.

title: Clippers' Harden surprised with court reveal, design on China tour
content: A basketball court with a larger-than-life image of James Harden was revealed in Guangzhou, China, on Monday.

title: Are high-priced foreign players really ready for the jump to the Premier League?
content: Digging into why the Premier League is so much more challenging for players than any other league in the world.

title: Man United passed their preseason tests. Now comes the real challenge
content: It's going to take more than good vibes to get Man United back into the top half of the Premier League table.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Watkins linked with Man United amid Sesko pursuit
content: Aston Villa striker Ollie Watkins could head to Manchester United, in the event that a move for RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko falls through. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's most important nonconference game
content: Regional rivalries, freshmen debuts and more of the most intriguing nonconference game to tune into for each preseason top 25 team.

title: Mock draft: QBs selected with five of first eight picks of 12-team PPR superflex
content: As expected, quarterbacks were popular early on, which meant some quality wide receivers and players with upside were available in the middle rounds.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts.

title: Pickups: Seven players seizing post-deadline opportunity
content: As the MLB season moves beyond the trade deadline, here are the players you should be claiming off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Betting buzz: Baldwin favorite as Misiorowski injury shakes up NL Rookie race
content: Drake Baldwin emerges as heavy NL Rookie of the Year favorite after Jacob Misiorowski's odds slide after injury.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: From another title in OKC to new plans in Phoenix, what is every team 'all-in' for in 2025-26?
content: Not everyone can be all-in for the title in 2025-26. See each franchise's priority No. 1 for the upcoming season.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including Chris Boucher to the Celtics
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Did Prograis, Duarte, Canizales do enough to enter the rankings?
content: The junior welterweight and junior flyweight division were in action this weekend. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Can Barça's title defense endure summer of self sabotage?
content: It's been one misstep after another for Barcelona, but on the field they're so strong it may not matter.

title: Missed wages, closed stand, quitting players: Why Sheffield Wednesday could go bust
content: Sheffield Wednesday are one of the most historically important clubs in England, but they could cease to exist.

title: 'I am useless': Hamilton spiraling in dire Ferrari debut year
content: In February, Lewis Hamilton was full of smiles, eager to win a championship for Ferrari. Six months later, he sounds defeated.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 QBs in Madden NFL 26
content: From Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson to Jayden Daniels, here are the top 10 quarterbacks in Madden NFL 26

title: Trump was asked about India’s claim on US importing Russian uranium, fertilisers; his response
content: Amidst criticism over India's Russian oil purchases, US President Donald Trump claimed ignorance about the US importing fertilizers and chemicals from Russia. He accused India of profiting from reselling Russian oil and threatened tariff hikes, prompting a strong rebuttal from India, which cited strategic necessity and questioned the hypocrisy of Western nations continuing their trade with Russia.

title: Uttarakhand flash floods: Homes buried, roads blocked; PM Modi speaks to CM Dhami - latest developments
content: A devastating flash flood struck Dharali village in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, triggered by a cloudburst. The deluge of water and debris flattened buildings, trapping dozens and resulting in casualties. Rescue operations are under way by army and NDRF teams, with efforts focused on clearing debris and restoring connectivity amidst challenging weather conditions. PM Modi assured full central support to CM Dhami.

title: NSA Doval in Russia amid Trump tariff threat: Key talks with Kremlin; will oil be on agenda?
content: Ajit Doval's Moscow visit centers on strengthening the strategic partnership, defense, and security cooperation between India and Russia amid evolving geopolitical dynamics. Discussions will encompass defense collaboration and Russian oil supplies to India. The visit occurs against the backdrop of US trade threats and criticism regarding India's energy imports from Russia, which India defends as safeguarding its national interests.

title: ‘Bhag, bhag!’: Man defies death, crawls out of debris as flash flood flattens Uttarkashi village - watch
content: A man miraculously survived a flash flood in Uttarkashi's Dharali village on Tuesday. Dramatic videos show him crawling from the debris after the deluge destroyed homes and roads. Though injured and covered in mud, he managed to escape the immediate danger. His identity and condition remain unknown, and it's unconfirmed if he received medical attention.

title: Google Pixel 10 teasers make fun of iPhone, says, 'If you buy new phone because ...'
content: Google is set to launch its Pixel 10 series on August 20, teasing the new phone in an advertisement that subtly mocks Apple's delayed AI features. The ad highlights the availability of advanced AI tools on Pixel phones, contrasting it with Apple's Siri revamp and generative AI features, which have been pushed back to 2026 due to reliability issues.

title: 'Languishes in premature retirement': Tharoor reignites call for Kohli's Test comeback
content: Shashi Tharoor has stirred debate by questioning Virat Kohli's Test retirement, deeming it premature after India's drawn series in England. He contrasted Kohli's situation with Joe Root's continued excellence, emphasising Kohli's potential impact on the recent series. Tharoor's appeal highlights Kohli's past success and leadership, igniting calls for his return to Test cricket.

title: Bird slams into plane: Cabin filled with smoke mid-air on Paris flight— watch
content: A Paris-bound plane from Madrid was compelled to make an emergency landing shortly after takeoff due to a bird strike, causing panic among passengers. The collision severely damaged the plane's nose, leading to smoke in the cabin and the deployment of oxygen masks.

title: Chennai Grand Masters: Tournament postponed after fire disrupts venue - Watch
content: The Chennai Grand Masters 2025 has been delayed by a day due to a fire at the Hyatt Regency, its venue. All players are safe and relocated. The tournament will now commence on August 7, with the first round on the original rest day.

title: 'What have we done?' — Why did Sam Altman 'feel useless' while testing ChatGPT-5
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has voiced serious concerns regarding GPT-5's capabilities, likening its development to the Manhattan Project. He admitted feeling "useless" after witnessing its problem-solving abilities. While GPT-5 promises advancements, Altman fears its potential societal impact, including fraud and disruption.

title: Gold price prediction: Where is yellow metal rate headed? Here’s the outlook
content: Gold prices are expected to remain range-bound with limited upward movement in the near term, according to Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. Despite a Friday rally driven by weak US job data and tariff concerns, a stronger US Dollar and risk-on sentiment are capping gains.

title: Baby bonus: China offers 10,800 yuan per child to boost birth rate
content: In the last week of July, the government announced a new plan to increase the birth rate. Parents will receive an annual subsidy of 3,600 yuan (about $500) for every child until the age of three. This scheme applies to children born since January 1, 2025. Over three years, a family can get up to 10,800 yuan for each child.

title: Stock market: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex near 80,700 ahead of RBI policy decision
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in flat in trade on Wednesday ahead of the RBI monetary policy review decision.

title: Angry at Mira Murati for refusing $1bn offer, Zuckerberg launched 'full-scale raid'
content: Meta's CEO, Mark Zuckerberg, reportedly attempted to acquire Mira Murati's startup, Thinking Machines Lab, with a $1 billion offer. After Murati declined, Zuckerberg allegedly launched a recruitment drive targeting its employees, including Andrew Tulloch, offering a potential $1.5 billion pay package.

title: 'Going to exert my powers': Here's why Trump has warned of federal control in DC
content: President Trump expressed outrage over rising crime in Washington, DC, threatening federal intervention after a Department of Government Efficiency member, Edward Coristine, was assaulted during a carjacking attempt. Trump demanded stricter laws to prosecute juvenile offenders as adults, emphasising the need for a safe and clean capital. Elon Musk also highlighted the incident, calling for federalising DC.

title: Glacier collapse or lake burst likely caused Dharali destruction: Experts
content: Experts suspect a glacier collapse or glacial lake breach, not a cloudburst, caused the devastating flash flood in Dharali village, Uttarkashi. Minimal rainfall was recorded, leading scientists to investigate a potential avalanche or lake burst upstream. Satellite images reveal glaciers and glacial lakes above the site, raising concerns about a sudden water release similar to the Raini disaster.

title: 'Picked a team not to lose': Ex-India cricketer slams Gambhir-Gill approach
content: Dinesh Karthik criticised Gautam Gambhir and Shubman Gill's leadership during the recent Test series against England, suggesting their cautious approach reflected a fear of defeat. Karthik highlighted Gambhir's significant influence on team decisions and emphasised the need to prioritise taking wickets. He also defended Jasprit Bumrah's workload management, dismissing claims that India performs better without him.

title: Trump, Gretzky and Tkachuk to revive youth Presidential Fitness Test
content: Donald Trump's President's Council on Sports, Fitness, and Nutrition includes Wayne Gretzky and Matthew Tkachuk. The Council will focus on fitness in schools. It aims to restore college athletic customs and protect women's sports. Matthew Tkachuk impressed the White House during the Florida Panthers' visit. He will help shape fitness programs for kids.

title: MoD clears big arms deals, including BrahMos, armed drones, worth Rs 67,000cr
content: India's defence ministry has approved the procurement of 87 armed drones and over 110 BrahMos missiles, along with other modernization proposals, totaling Rs 67,000 crore. The acquisition of MALE drones, to be produced with 60% indigenous content, aims to enhance the capabilities of the three services, while the BrahMos missiles will further strengthen the firepower of Sukhoi-30MKI fighters.

title: Amit Shah now India's longest-serving home minister
content: Amit Shah has surpassed L.K. Advani to become the longest-serving Home Minister, a milestone celebrated by PM Modi who lauded Shah's tenure marked by key decisions such as the revocation of J&K's special status and the enactment of the CAA. Shah's leadership, including his role in Operation Sindoor, was highlighted as a testament to India's strong political resolve.

title: Uttarkashi disaster: Videos show Dharali wiped out in 20 seconds; buildings crumbled like cardboard pieces
content: Terrifying videos captured the moment a massive wave of water and debris devastated Dharali village in Uttarkashi district, flattening buildings and sweeping away people. The surge, triggered around 1:50 pm, reduced the bustling marketplace to rubble in seconds. Authorities have confirmed four deaths, but fear the toll could rise as rescue operations continue, with the Army, NDRF, and SDRF involved.

title: 'Bumrah didn’t win the Test match — Siraj did,' says ex-Australia cricketer
content: Former Australian cricketer Brad Haddin sparked debate by suggesting Jasprit Bumrah didn't secure Test wins for India during their England tour, despite being their leading wicket-taker. Haddin praised Mohammed Siraj's leadership and eagerness in crucial moments, highlighting his resilience and impact on the team's performance, ultimately helping India level the series 2-2.

title: 'Miyan Magic' tops the charts: Siraj surpasses Bumrah for this big record
content: Mohammed Siraj has emerged as India's leading pacer in away Tests, surpassing Jasprit Bumrah. His stellar performance in the recent India-England series, where he took 23 wickets, solidified his position. Siraj's impactful spells, including a six-wicket haul at Birmingham and a crucial five-for at The Oval, were instrumental in India's victories.

title: WATCH: 'Bande in taange jama di goron ki' – Ex-India cricketer on Siraj
content: Yograj Singh praised Mohammed Siraj, drawing comparisons to Kapil Dev, and lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy amidst initial criticism. He emphasized the team's fighting spirit, viewing the series draw against England as a hard-fought victory. Yograj expressed immense pride in the Indian team's resilience and determination throughout the series, highlighting their unwavering commitment.

title: Nostalgia for SRH fans: Warner, Williamson walk out together to bat – Watch
content: The Hundred 2025 began at Lord's with a nostalgic reunion for Sunrisers Hyderabad fans as David Warner and Kane Williamson batted together for London Spirit. Despite the heartwarming moment, Oval Invincibles dominated, bowling out Spirit for 80. Rashid Khan and Sam Curran starred with the ball. The Invincibles chased the target swiftly, winning by six wickets.

title: Trump eyes tough tariffs: Targets nations buying Russian oil; claims 'talks with Russia soon'
content: Donald Trump hinted at potential tariff actions against countries like India and China for importing energy from Russia, citing concerns about fueling the war in Ukraine. He expressed dissatisfaction with India's trade practices and hinted at substantially raising tariffs due to their continued oil trade with Russia.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for August 6
content: Anand Rathi Shares suggests buying GRSE, Redington, and Raymond Realty. GRSE shows mean reversion and weekly reversal patterns. Redington indicates hidden bullish divergence and pullback setup. Raymond Realty displays momentum revival after correction.

title: WATCH: Fox on the field! Lord’s crowd erupts as wild visitor interrupts game
content: In a bizarre interruption at Lord's, a fox stole the show during The Hundred 2025 opener between London Spirit and Oval Invincibles. The furry intruder halted play, sparking amusement among spectators and commentators alike. Despite the delay, Oval Invincibles secured a six-wicket victory, chasing down London Spirit's 81-run target with Rashid Khan's stellar performance earning him Player of the Match.

title: Pakistan, Turkiye & Bangladesh not on list of invitees for RSS centenary celebration
content: The RSS will celebrate its centenary with a series of dialogues led by Mohan Bhagwat, focusing on its history, nation-building role, and future vision. While reaching out to various domestic and foreign entities, invitations will not be extended to the embassies of Pakistan, Turkiye, and Bangladesh due to the current geopolitical context.

title: Call for debate on Op Sindoor backfired on opposition: PM Modi
content: PM Modi asserted that the opposition's demand for a debate on Operation Sindoor backfired, exposing their reluctance to acknowledge the armed forces' success. He urged NDA leaders to amplify the voice of a "New India" resolutely responding to terrorists. Modi also highlighted the historical significance of August 5 and encouraged participation in upcoming events like the Tiranga Yatra.

title: 'Son of Sardaar 2' box office: Ajay Devgn starrer sees steady growth
content: Despite facing competition, 'Son of Sardaar 2' has maintained a steady performance at the Indian box office, earning approximately Rs 2.50 crore on Day 5, bringing its total to around Rs 29.60 crore. The film's consistent weekday numbers and positive word-of-mouth suggest it will continue its momentum into the second weekend. 'Mahavatar Narsimha' continues to dominate the box office.

title: 'Another way to spend my money': Trump jokes about nukes on roof; mimics missile launch
content: President Trump was spotted on the White House roof, accompanied by architect James McCrery, inspecting potential construction sites. Joking about installing "nuclear missiles," Trump highlighted his personal funding for projects. He also mentioned exploring ways to spend his money for the country.

title: As costs pinch, auto companies hike prices
content: After a period of softening, commodity prices are rising again, prompting auto companies to implement minor price hikes. Steel price increases, in particular, are causing concern, with analysts predicting continued hardening of raw material prices in the coming quarters. While the immediate impact on margins is limited, auto bosses are closely monitoring the situation as a potential headwind.

title: India mulls new pilot training system as air traffic booms
content: India is contemplating a significant overhaul of its pilot training program, potentially introducing the multi-crew pilot license (MPL) system alongside the existing commercial pilot license (CPL). This move aims to address the burgeoning demand for pilots in the rapidly expanding Indian aviation sector.

title: Long-range precision hits had psychological impact on Pakistan: CDS
content: General Anil Chauhan stated that Operation Sindoor, involving long-range precision strikes during cross-border hostilities in May, had a significant psychological impact on Pakistan. He emphasized that the operation, which is still ongoing, aimed to achieve political goals through targeted action rather than territorial gains.

title: 'Saiyaara' collection: Ahaan Panday’s romantic film slows down to Rs 2.5 cr
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda slows down after a successful run. The film earned ₹2.50 crore on its third Tuesday, bringing the total to ₹304.60 crore. New releases like 'Mahavtar Narsimha', 'Son Of Sardaar 2' and 'Dhadak 2' affect 'Saiyaara's' performance. The film faces further competition with the upcoming release of 'War 2'.

title: Travel loans overtake house renovation, medical: Study
content: Indians are increasingly financing their vacations with personal loans, surpassing home renovations and medical needs as the primary reason. A recent report indicates that 27% of borrowers took loans for travel in the first half of 2025, fueled by millennials and a rapidly growing Gen Z segment.

title: 'One of the worst orders': In a 1st, SC bars HC judge from hearing criminal cases
content: The Supreme Court has strongly criticized Allahabad High Court's Justice Prashant Kumar for allowing criminal proceedings in a civil dispute, deeming it an "erroneous order." The SC bench, led by Justices Pardiwala and Mahadevan, questioned Justice Kumar's competence and barred him from handling criminal cases until retirement.

title: CISF in well, claims Kharge, Rijiju says House being misled
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed a heated debate between LoP Kharge and Deputy Chairman Harivansh regarding alleged CISF presence during opposition protests. Kharge claimed a violation of democratic rights, while the Chair and treasury benches refuted it, stating only Parliament marshals were present. The House later approved extending President's Rule in Manipur.

title: Eye on Beijing, Delhi & Manila unite in strategic partnership
content: India and the Philippines have elevated their relationship to a strategic partnership, emphasizing expanded cooperation in defence, security, and maritime domains. This development includes finalizing terms for joint military exercises and India's support for freedom of navigation in the Indo-Pacific. Both nations voiced concerns over China's actions in the South China Sea, reaffirming the importance of the 2016 arbitral award.

title: SC grants Rs 4cr Mumbai flat as alimony, rejects Rs 12cr & BMW demand
content: The Supreme Court, employing its Article 142 powers, dissolved a marriage by directing the husband to gift his wife a Rs 4 crore Mumbai flat. The court rejected the wife's demand for an additional Rs 12 crore and a BMW, deeming the flat sufficient alimony given her education and potential for self-support, while also considering the husband's current unemployment.

title: EC suspends 4 officers for doctoring Bengal poll roll
content: The Election Commission has taken strict action against West Bengal officials for manipulating the electoral roll. Officers in Baruipur Purba and Moyna constituencies are suspended and face FIRs for adding names without verification and sharing login credentials. This follows reports of similar lapses by other officials.

title: Central green nod not needed for constructions of 20,000-150,000 sqm
content: The Supreme Court has reactivated stalled construction projects, including housing, industrial sheds, and educational institutions, with covered areas between 20,000 and 1,50,000 square meters. These projects can now proceed with clearance from the State Environment Impact Assessment Authority (SEIAA), exempting them from central environmental clearance.

title: Big INDIA bloc parties reject smaller allies' plea to find a way to let Parliament run
content: Opposition members of the INDIA bloc are divided over the ongoing parliamentary disruption concerning the special intensive revision of Bihar's electoral rolls. While some MPs urged for a return to normal proceedings, larger parties insisted on holding the government accountable for allegedly evading discussion on the critical issue.

title: SC asks Bar Council to probe controversy over 'ghost litigant'
content: The Supreme Court is grappling with a perplexing case involving a 'ghost litigant' who secured a favorable order based on a fabricated compromise. With lawyers denying involvement, the court has directed the Bar Council of India to investigate the matter.

title: Mamata visits flood affected areas in south Bengal; inspects condition, offers flood relief
content: A day ago, the CM blamed the Damodar Valley Corporation and their increased water release for flooding multiple districts of West Bengal; DVC officials have refuted the claims

title: NSA in Moscow, as Trump delivers fresh threats of sanctions on Indian import of Russian oil
content: NSA talks to discuss security cooperation, ahead of Putin’s visit to India this year, EAM Jaishankar expected to travel to Moscow soon

title: Call to unearth contemporary knowledge from Sanskrit
content: Odisha Governor Kambhampati Hari Babu called Sanskrit as not just a language, but a ‘living legacy’ that guides human life

title: How should money laundering be tackled? | Explained
content: What did the Finance Minister report with respect to the number of cases under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act? What are the three stages through which money is laundered? How will the Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement help to stop illegal transfer of money?

title: Bihar Cabinet approves domicile policy in school teachers’ appointment
content: Policy will give priority to Bihar’s youths over youths of other States. Cabinet also hiked honorariums for school cooks, watchmen, Physical Education instructors, Mamata, ASHA and Sanitation workers

title: Two Indian-origin men drown in Colorado river
content: Investigators said that the two victims had been underwater for approximately 20 minutes when divers arrived on scene and were located in approximately 12 feet of water

title: India, Russia reaffirm commitment to enhance defence cooperation
content: The meeting took place amid U.S. President Donald Trump’s threats to slap harsh sanctions on India for buying crude oil from Russia

title: Bombay High Court denies bail to ex-BJP MLA for shooting inside police station
content: The court observed that allowing a violent crime of such magnitude to occur within the secure confines of a police station undermines public confidence in the law enforcement system’s ability to uphold peace and order

title: Tunnel slope collapses in north Bengal’s Kalimpong area triggered by heavy rainfall
content: No casualties or injuries were reported from the ground even though the concrete structure collapsed within seconds

title: SIT to probe allegation of police burying girl’s body in Dharmasthala village without filing case
content: In the complaint filed with the Dharmasthala police on August 4, one T. Jayant alleged that the body of a 15-year-old girl was found lying on the roadside in the village between 2002 and 2003

title: The importance of retaining College Road’s name
content: College Road does not take its name from Women’s Christian College but from the College of Fort St. George, which functioned at what is today the Directorate of Public Instructions premises, between 1812 and 1854

title: Trump’s 25% tariff likely to hit seafood exports from Andhra Pradesh
content: Aqua farmers have to bear 35% tariff, including 25% tariff, 5.77% countervailing duty and 3.96% anti-dumping duty from August 7, says Seafood Exporters Association of India

title: What the 1871 educational census shows about the divide in the pyall schools of Madras Presidency
content: A forgotten 1871 census reveals how caste, class and religion shaped not just what children learned, but how much their teachers earned in British-era Madras Presidency

title: Over ₹1,000 crore siphoned off through cyber frauds in 4 years in Madhya Pradesh; recovery rate below 0.2%
content: Congress MLA Jaivardhan Singh said that the low recovery rate in cyber scam cases reflects that the police are “not at all equipped to deal with the problem of cyber fraud”.

title: When an engineer was murdered opposing his love marriage with a medical student in Chennai
content: The recent murder of Kavin Selvaganesh, a Scheduled Caste youth, by his girlfriend’s brother belonging to Most Backward Caste in Tirunelveli district has shaken Tamil Nadu. However, its a misconception that such crimes occur only in remote villages or the southern districts of the State. Even urban areas like Chennai witness such brutal acts driven by caste.

title: CDS Chauhan urges swift tech adoption and defence reforms amid evolving warfare
content: The CDS urged military practitioners to embrace a proactive, indigenous and adaptive vision anchored in strategic foresight, technological autonomy and doctrinal agility.

title: Open office concept in Central government offices irks officials
content: All Ministries are set to move to new office buildings built at Kartavya Path; however, the government officials’ body has said that in the new buildings, officers are being allotted lesser spaces than mandated, impacting confidentiality and efficiency

title: Honest officers must be protected: SC on challenges to amend anti-graft Act
content: The court was hearing a petition filed by the non-profit organisation challenging Section 17A of the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988, which bars any “enquiry or inquiry or investigation” against a public servant for recommendations made in discharge of official duties without prior approval from the competent authority

title: DAC approves defence procurement worth ₹67,000 crore to strengthen border security
content: Acceptance of Necessity was accorded for the procurement of Medium Altitude Long Endurance (MALE) Remotely Piloted Aircraft (RPAs) for the three services.

title: House of Muthulakshmi Reddy, India’s first woman medicine graduate, in a dilapidated state
content: Sources in Avvai Home and Adyar Cancer Institute express willingness to renovate the building; Minister P.K. Sekarbabu promises to inspect the site soon and put the facility to good use

title: Chikungunya cases surge in Telangana; Centre and State report contradictory figures
content: The number presented in the Lok Sabha is wrong; we don’t know how that data was generated, but it is not consistent with our records, says Telangana Health officer

title: Hyderabad’s drain game fails: Collapsed vents suspected in Ameerpet deluge
content: Monday’s downpour exposed gaping holes, from collapsed vents and choked drains to under-capacity holding tanks, leaving key roads in Hyderabad inundated

title: Built-over lakes return to haunt prime areas of Hyderabad
content: In a span of two hours, with nearly 10 centimetres of rain lashing central parts of the city, stormwater rose through the old drainage routes

title: Manifold increase in rabies deaths in two years: Centre
content: In 2024, the highest number of rabies deaths was reported from Tamil Nadu (43), followed by Karnataka (42) and Andhra Pradesh (39). In 2023, 121 people died of rabies and 2,223 presumptive cases were reported

title: Do not summon petitioner to police station: High Court
content: Vadhtya Ramulu alleged that Maheshwaram police were harassing him since he sought a probe into purchase of Bhoodan lands by some IAS and IPS officers

title: Venugopal seeks closure of case against nuns held in Chhattisgarh
content: Congress leader writes to Home Minister and Chhattisgarh CM; demands action against Bajrang Dal members

title: Construction of Common Central Secretariat buildings to be over in 22 months: Khattar
content: Several ministries housed in Shastri Bhavan, Krishi Bhavan, Nirman Bhavan and Udyog Bhavan in the national capital will soon shift to new locations on Kasturba Gandhi Marg, Minto Road, and Netaji Palace temporarily for two years

title: ‘Kaiga units operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions’
content: The four units of KGS have operated continuously for over 500 days on eight occasions and over 365 days on 19 occasions, thus setting benchmark parameters for the operating stations of Nuclear Power Corporation of India Limited

title: Kolhapur elephant row: Maharashtra government to file a review petition in SC over animal’s transfer to Vantara
content: Chief Minister Fadnavis says a special team will be formed to care for elephant Madhuri after her return from the rescue/rehabilitation centre

title: PMK senior leaders believe voters, and not office-bearers, will decide the party leadership
content: Both factions have started talking with other parties to ensure that they remain in pole position. While Dr. Anbumani has embarked on a padayatra, focusing on the PMK strongholds and presenting himself as the face of the party, Dr. Ramadoss, 86, is headlining a women’s conference at Poompuhar on August 10

title: UPSC plans to send recruitment alerts to institutions via email
content: The UPSC Chairman said that “posts remained vacant or became infructuous during the interview stage as suitable candidates are not found by the interview board”

title: Army says no ceasefire violation along LoC
content: “There have been some media and social media reports regarding ceasefire violation in Poonch region. It is clarified that there has been no ceasefire violation along the LoC. Please avoid spreading unverified information,” the Army said in a statement.

title: Two-day seminar in State capital to focus on tribal life and knowledge
content: Workshop brings together activists, scholars, artists, ethnic food experts, tribal healers, and community representatives from Kerala and beyond. It aims at providing a comprehensive understanding of tribal life, with a focus on cultural, ecological, and socio-political dimensions

title: Caste killing: investigation will be completed in 60 days, Tamil Nadu government informs High Court
content: An interim compensation of ₹6 lakh has already been handed over to the family. A case has been booked under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act. No offender will be allowed to go scot free, says the government

title: Go beyond politics to work towards improving city’s infrastructure, urges Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: The Union Minister said rail connectivity within the city and to the city from outside will be doubled in the next three years

title: Madras High Court orders disciplinary action against five IPS officers for dereliction of duty
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also orders initiation of departmental action against 11 Inspectors who had served at Kullanchavadi police station in Cuddalore district since 2015

title: BBMP bans PoP Ganesha idols, plans over 40 immersion sites in Bengaluru
content: In addition, temporary mobile immersion tanks will be set up at key locations and major junctions in each ward

title: Amaravati hackathon to promote culture of innovation and problem-solving
content: Registration for the event started and August 12 is the last day for submission of ideas by college teams on AQVH 2025 portal

title: Allahabad High Court judge Prashant Kumar ‘cut a sorry figure for himself, made mockery of justice’: Supreme Court
content: The apex court reprimands Justice Prashant Kumar, says he found nothing wrong in a litigant filing a criminal case against a buyer in a purely civil dispute over an unpaid balance of money in a sale transaction

title: BDA gets approval to form six new layouts along PRR-2
content: Apart from planned development along the new road, these layouts are also being taken up to compensate land losers to the road project with developed land along the road.

title: BBMP rolls out faceless e-Khata system to boost transparency, curb middlemen
content: The new Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) ensures that applications are randomly assigned to officials, irrespective of the zone they are deputed to, and applicants will not know which officer is handling their case which eliminates direct contact and any sort of influence

title: Karnataka High Court directs State government to submit Commission report on Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede
content: We also organised RCB team’s facilitation on the steps of Vidhana Soudha upon Government’s request, DNA Networks tells Court

title: Two women dead, three injured in fall at religious gathering in Madhya Pradesh’s Sehore
content: Police attribute incident to crowding at Kubereshwar Dham during Rudraksha distribution; no stampede reported

title: Non-lowering of national flag after sunset in itself is not an offence, says Kerala HC
content: Court quashes criminal proceedings against Secretary of Angamaly municipality for allegedly not lowering the flag at the municipal office for almost two days after Independence Day in 2015

title: Internal quota: panel proposes 6% for Dalit left, 5% for Dalit right
content: H.N. Nagamohan Das panel is learnt to have created a separate group for Adi Karnataka, Adi Dravida and Adi Andhra, providing 1% reservation for the three

title: On eve of global plastic talks, DMK MP pushes India to take ‘lead role’
content: The meeting should make way for legally binding obligations that span the entire life cycle of plastics, Thamizhachi Thangapandian suggests in her letter to the Environment Minister

title: Urea ‘smuggling’: BJP demands probe and White Paper on supply situation
content: ‘The shocking seizure of urea being smuggled from Karnataka to Kerala is not just illegal; it is also a direct betrayal of Karnataka’s farmers’

title: Bengaluru largely unfazed as RTC strike disrupts bus services across Karnataka
content: As of 6 p.m., the overall operational rate of four corporations across the State stood at 71.9%, with major variations in performance among the four State-run transport corporations

title: Amid tariff row, Army shares 1971 newspaper clipping highlighting U.S. arms supply to Pakistan
content: Article published on August 5, 1971 quotes a Minister telling Parliament that the U.S. had shipped arms worth $2 billion to Pakistan since 1954, adding that the U.S. and China supplied Pakistan with arms at concessional rates

title: ED attaches assets in cyberfraud case
content: Properties linked to U.S.-arrested accused Chirag Tomar, his family and entities traced to cyber fraud

title: Congress leaders in New Delhi to expedite reorganisation process
content: KPCC president Sunny Joseph, Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan, and United Democratic Front convener Adoor Prakash hold marathon meetings with MPs, reportedly to ease purported intra-party tensions over recasting district congress committees

title: If Stalin has given good administration, then why hold outreach programmes: Palaniswami
content: The former Chief Minister lashes out at the DMK government for closing down 2,000 pro-poor ‘Amma Mini Clinics’ and discontinuing distribution of laptops to schoolchildren

title: Trump Says Lula Can Call Him. "I Will Call PM Modi," Replies Brazil Leader
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Tuesday turned down his US counterpart Donald Trump's offer to call him anytime to discuss tariffs, saying Rio de Janeiro would instead use all available resources, including the WTO, to defend itself.

title: Uttarakhand Flash Floods Live Updates: 4 Dead, 50 Missing In Uttarkashi After Cloudburst, Rescue Ops Underway
content: A cloudburst struck Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Tuesday afternoon which triggered a mudslide and flash floods in Dharalivillage.

title: Did Ashok Gehlot Just Buy Land Rover Defender? A Clarification
content: A video of former Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot getting out of a White Defender car is viral on social media, weeks after he was requested by a supporter to change his old vehicle and get one of the luxury vehicles.

title: Gaza Civil Defence Says Israeli Attacks Kill 68 In 24 Hours
content: Gaza's civil defence agency said 68 people were killed by Israeli gunfire and air strikes on Tuesday, including 56 who were waiting near aid distribution sites inside the Palestinian territory.

title: Trump Was Asked If US Imports Uranium, Fertilisers From Russia. His Reply
content: Amid the United States' tariff threats to India over Russian oil imports, US President Donald Trump has claimed he was unaware of Washington's uranium and fertiliser trade with Moscow.

title: One Of The "Worst" Orders: Top Court Takes High Court Judge Off Criminal Cases
content: In an unprecedented order, the Supreme Court has stripped criminal matters of the roster of a Allahabad High Court judge "till he demits office" after he "erroneously" upheld summons of criminal nature in a civil dispute.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Seeking Trump Pardon: Lawyer
content: Music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs, who is to be sentenced in October for his conviction on prostitution-related charges, is seeking a pardon from President Donald Trump, one of his lawyers said Tuesday.

title: Japan Marks 80th Anniversary Of Hiroshima Atomic Bombing
content: Hiroshima on Wednesday marked the 80th anniversary of the U.S. atomic bombing of the western Japanese city, with many aging survivors expressing frustration about growing support among global leaders for nuclear weapons possession for deterrence.

title: Australia's Great Barrier Reef Suffers Record Coral Decline Following Mass Bleaching
content: Australia's Great Barrier Reef has suffered the largest decline in coral cover in two of its three regions over the last year, research released on Wednesday showed, following a mass bleaching of its corals that was among the worst on record.

title: Tej Pratap Announces Formation Of 5-Party Coalition Ahead Of Bihar Polls
content: Former Bihar minister Tej Pratap Yadav on Tuesday announced the formation of a coalition of five minor parties to contest the assembly elections in the eastern state.

title: Israel Considering Ordering Total Occupation Of Gaza, Says Report
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that Israel must "complete" the defeat of Hamas in Gaza to secure the release of the remaining hostages, days ahead of a cabinet meeting to discuss an updated war plan.

title: Trump Envoy To Meet With Russian Leadership In Moscow Today
content: U.S. special envoy Steve Witkoff will be in Moscow on Wednesday to meet with Russian leadership, a source familiar with the plan said on Tuesday.

title: India, Russia Reaffirm Commitment To Enhance Defence Ties Amid Trump Threat
content: India and Russia on Tuesday reaffirmed their commitment to boost bilateral defence cooperation during a meeting between Indian Ambassador Vinay Kumar and Russia's Deputy Defence Minister Colonel-General Alexander Fomin.

title: No Caste Discrimination In Water Distribution: Madras High Court's Big Order
content: In a powerful and far-reaching order, the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has condemned caste-based discrimination in access to public water resources and directed statewide implementation of equitable practices.

title: CRPF Woman Claims Police Inaction After Burglary In House In Tamil Nadu
content: A video of a woman personnel of CRPF in uniform alleging police inaction over a burglary at her family home in Vellore has gone viral, sparking debate over crime response and law enforcement accountability in Tamil Nadu.

title: 13-Year-Old Boy Dies After Being Hit By Speeding Truck In UP: Cops
content: A 13-year-old boy died after being hit by a speeding truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi district on Tuesday, police said.

title: In Conservation Win, Tamil Nadu State Animal Nilgiri Tahr's Numbers Shoot Up
content: In a major conservation success story, the endangered Nilgiri Tahr - Tamil Nadu's state animal - has shown a significant rise in numbers.

title: Trump Says Tariffs On Pharma, Chips Coming By "Next Week Or So"
content: US President Donald Trump signaled Tuesday that fresh tariffs on imported pharmaceuticals and semiconductors could be unveiled as soon as the coming week, as he presses on in efforts to reshape global trade.

title: US Should Not Burn Relationship With "Strong Ally Like India": Nikki Haley
content: US should not burn its relationship with a "strong ally like India" and give a pass to China, Nikki Haley said on Tuesday, amid President Donald Trump's attacks against New Delhi over tariffs and purchases of Russian oil.

title: Ajit Doval In Moscow Amid US Tariff Threat Over India's Russian Oil Imports
content: Amid stiffening ties between US and India over Russian oil imports, National Security Adviser Ajit Doval arrived in Moscow for a visit aimed at strengthening ties between Russia and India.

title: WR Allen returns to Chargers, home for 11 years
content: WR keenan Allen returns to the Chargers, home for 11 years . he spent the first 11 years of his NFL career with the chargers . the 33-year-old will reunite with quarterback Justin Herbert . we have reporters with all 32 teams, covering the ins and outs of camp .

title: Training camp battles to watch for all 32 teams
content: training camps are off and running, and the 2025 season is right around the corner . players spend camp making their cases to be included on the final 53-man rosters at the end of august . coaches are seeking clarity on who starts and who will provide backup .

title: Catching up on the Big 12: Power Rankings, key players, must-see games
content: the big 12 title looks to be available to nearly any team in the conference . the conference's elite will look to join the offseason . this year, Texas Tech, fresh off a massive push to bring in new talent . dillingham's Arizona State Sun Devils were picked in the preseason media poll .

title: 'This is truly a startup': How the 'new' Pac-12 is taking shape
content: the Pac-12 has existed in various states of transition . the future is beginning to take shape, says commissioner Teresa Gould . "it's not the old Pac-12 -- it's a new Pac-12," says commissioner .

title: Biggest concern, what's left to play for and more: Post-trade-deadline guide for all 30 MLB teams
content: the 2025 trade deadline featured 92 veteran trade candidates on new teams . 92 prospects headed to new organizations seeking their big league opportunity . this is what we do with every edition of Stock Watch . there is never as much mystery in the outcomes as there is after a heavy period of roster movement .

title: Here comes the Judge! AL MVP favorite returns
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . everything else will be played under clear conditions or in a dome . the new york Yankees will activate Aaron Judge from the 10-day IL in advance of Tuesday night's road tilt with the Texas Rangers .
